Parsing and rendering unordered list item with '*' and '-'.

>>> with_star
= Unordered list with star

With star,

* Star 1
* Star 2
** Star 2.1
*** Star 2.1.1
** Star 2.2
* Star 3
* Star 4

<<< with_star

<div class="paragraph">
<p>With star,</p>
</div>
<div class="ulist">
<ul>
<li>
<p>Star 1</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Star 2</p>
<div class="ulist">
<ul>
<li>
<p>Star 2.1</p>
<div class="ulist">
<ul>
<li>
<p>Star 2.1.1</p>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
</li>
<li>
<p>Star 2.2</p>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
</li>
<li>
<p>Star 3</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Star 4</p>
</li>
</ul>
</div>

>>> with_dash
= Unordered list with dash

With dash,

- Dash 1
- Dash 2
-- Dash 2.1
--- Dash 2.1.1
-- Dash 2.2
- Dash 3
- Dash 4

<<< with_dash

<div class="paragraph">
<p>With dash,</p>
</div>
<div class="ulist">
<ul>
<li>
<p>Dash 1</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Dash 2</p>
<div class="ulist">
<ul>
<li>
<p>Dash 2.1</p>
<div class="ulist">
<ul>
<li>
<p>Dash 2.1.1</p>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
</li>
<li>
<p>Dash 2.2</p>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
</li>
<li>
<p>Dash 3</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Dash 4</p>
</li>
</ul>
</div>

>>> quoted_paragraph
= Quoted paragraph

"A line
of Quote"
-- Author Name, Citation Name

<<< quoted_paragraph

<div class="quoteblock">
<blockquote>
A line
of Quote
</blockquote>
<div class="attribution">
&#8212; Author Name<br>
<cite>Citation Name</cite>
</div>
</div>

>>> list_item_with_quoted_paragraph
= List item with quote paragraph

* List item 1
+
"a quote"
-- Thomas Jefferson, Papers of Thomas Jefferson: Volume 11

* List item 2

<<< list_item_with_quoted_paragraph

<div class="ulist">
<ul>
<li>
<p>List item 1</p>
<div class="quoteblock">
<blockquote>
a quote
</blockquote>
<div class="attribution">
&#8212; Thomas Jefferson<br>
<cite>Papers of Thomas Jefferson: Volume 11</cite>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li>
<p>List item 2</p>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
